low: Too little salt in water makes fish lose body water, making them sick and die
Freshwater makes fish body balance go wrong, hurting inside parts and causing damage
Water with no salt makes fish more likely to catch sicknesses easily
Low salt affects fish making babies, fewer eggs survive and grow
Freshwater problems hurt fish breathing parts, making them struggle to get air
Low salt disrupts body balance, making nerves and muscles work poorly
Fresh conditions make fish change how they eat, growing slower and wasting feed
Salt shortage affects body building, making fish bones and skin weak
Low salt lets bad wastes build up, poisoning fish and causing deaths
Freshwater reduces helpful living things, cutting down food for plant roots
high: Too much salt makes fish lose body water too quickly, hurting their bodies
Salt level too high affects fish egg growing, fewer babies are born healthy
High salt hurts breathing part balance, making air exchange harder
Too much salt changes body chemicals, affecting growth and how they use food
Mixed salt conditions make fish use more energy to balance, growing slower
High salt raises stress signals, making fish more prone to illness
Too much salt affects food taste senses, making fish eat less
Salt-mixed water lets parasites grow more, hurting fish health and numbers
Salt extremes make body cells dry out, affecting organs and food use
High salt conditions put stress on cleaning systems and hurt plant water quality
